title: Riot has gone silent.
body:
I'm the author of this post: https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/q3scZE41-thoughts-on-rengar-revert
There has been an insane amount of attention my post has gotten, more upvotes than I've ever seen. 

There is no way Riot, at least 1 employee, has not seen this.

Why have you gone silent Riot. We are your community and drive your game forward.

We can't drive League of Legends forward if you keep driving us back.

replies.body:
Hey everyone,

I do want to start this response with acknowledging a couple of things. WE do read these posts, we do think about it and we do talk about them with each other. It can take some time for us to gather what we want to say about each topic which is why it may feel like we are silent, sometimes. There are many ways a single response can be taken, so we like to have everything in line before we talk so that we can communicate our intentions clearly.

Rengar is clearly on a lot of people's minds right now. PLEASE do not think you are throwing feedback down an abyss. Please do not think we are ignoring players about Rengar. We are not, as we do love this game and are players as well. 

While we don't have any plans to touch Rengar currently I want to stress that these conversations between players can help us build ideas in the future. So thank you for taking the time to respond and make posts about things that you care about.

-Ranger XIV

I guess I'll let it flow then. Here's a few points to consider for future assassins:

1. Hard cc doesn't belong anywhere on an assassin's kit. They should have to _work_ for the kill. I love playing Ekko but I can't get over how unfair Parallel Convergence feels on his kit, especially when paired with a well-timed Chronobreak.
2. Methods to cleanse cc don't belong anywhere on an assassin's kit. If an assassin engages an at improper moment in time, that's _their_ fault. They shouldn't have a Get Out of Jail for Free button built into their kit(s).
3. Assassins should be about skill expression. Their kits should include skillshots. They shouldn't be able to kill people by left clicking on them (i.e. LeBlanc, Katarina, Akali, etc.).
4. Assassins should be mobile but not _too mobile_ (so that Kassadin's ult range doesn't have to get cut in half again). Their mobility should feel necessary and measured, not unfair and excessive (like Fizz's Playful/Trickster invulnerability frames). 

Lastly, what did you do with the thirteen rangers that came before you?

> Hard cc doesn't belong anywhere on an assassin's kit.

I realize this will be a controversial and pointed question, but I'm still going to ask it in the hope that you will hear me out and give a thoughtful response or pass this on to other Rioters. I am asking this earnestly in the hopes of improving future reworks since this isn't a new issue.

Why should whether Rengar be a diver or assassin be up solely to the team/designer? Why shouldn't the players have more of a say? Isn't there a pretty big problem when Rengar, who was included in the assassin update and a Rioter gave a sarcastic reply that yes of course that means Rengar would stay an assassin, is suddenly listed as a diver by Riot when the class sub lists came out without any warning? Shouldn't getting existing player buy-in matter much more when it comes to major shifts in role like this? This feels very similar to Morde, who Riot hamfisted into Bot lane without any buy-in from players on such a major role change. And we all know how that turned out. It may be that Rengar is overall healthier for the game if he is a diver, but it should be on Riot to make that case to the players, not just drop things seemingly out of the blue.

The communication just doesn't feel like it is there when Riot makes major role changes like this. It just feels capricious and up to the whim of who happens to be working on the champ at the time, without taking the long term views of the playerbase into much account.

They have probably gone silent because of the community reaction on the boards.

Right now it seems like a witch hunt rather than a "let's fix Rengar" thing at the current moment in time. People want the old kit instead of trying to find a compromise between his new kit and hit old kit.

In other words... if you want them to respond, you'll either have to give it time, or figure out a way to calm the community down a bit. It's like taking a lollipop from a baby, they'll cry for a while then calm down when they get tired.

If you want them to listen to a Rengar rework, then please, consider the following:

His Q, if possible, should not be an auto attack enhancer. This is too reliable on a champion with an ult that lets them leap on their target from further than a ranged basic attack can handle, as well as just being able to do this from bushes.

His old Q was too hard to balance. It gave too little room for his enemies to fight and too much for the Rengar. If possible, it should *not* be returned, because of these reasons. It probably tied down Rengar's power budget a little too much as a result.

His new Q, however, suffers from other problems. It solved the whole "no counter for opponents" thing because he had to already be next to his foes, but it feels... off, all around, from what I'm hearing. Clunky and just not fitting with Rengar himself.

So in other words, you need to think of a Q that is not only smooth and easy to use, but also something an enemy can play around besides "stay X units away from Rengar or pain ensues."

His W... I don't know the direction it should go, whether proactive or reactive. Both seem to have their own issues, so that is probably for those more qualified than me to say.

His E is stated to be fine, so we can leave that. No need to fix something that doesn't need fixing.

And finally, his Ult. His R. The infamous "I'm going to kill you and there is almost nothing you can do to stop me" ability. Time and time again, this ult has proved to be far too problematic. So what I suggest is simple; change it entirely.

It's clear that the ult, regardless of what it gives, will be a problem just because of the nature of how it works. If Rengar is ahead, you can't stop him unless you are a one main CC chaining master. If he's behind, it does nothing to help him. So why not make it more interesting instead of "stealth and see everything"? Make it so that Rengar has to interact with his surroundings. Like Rengar can leap from bush to bush around the map (not globally of course), or make it so that Rengar can track his foes. Simply revealing and giving an indicator doesn't seem to be cutting it balance wise.

No, I'm not a Rengar main. I have played him in all his forms, and quite frankly, it's beginning to become overly obvious that Riot wants to avoid certain designs for Rengar, and players simply want a revert because of *other reasons*. Find a middle ground and work from there. His old kit won't cut it, but that doesn't mean you have to scrap everything.
My entire post was a concept on how to reach a compromise between the two. I didn't treat like a witch hunt, and all the comments are people asking for a response from riot.

Even if you are not witch hunting, that's the current perception. There will be immediate negative comments and essentially attacking the Riot employees if they respond now.

I don't agree with it all. The old Q alone was not bad, it wasn't oneshotting anyone. The problem was when you'd load/prepare it all before ulting, resulting in a massive burst. If pretty much everything BUT the ult was reverted, with the exception that ult can't crit, Rengar would be pretty solid although his ult would still remain a zoning ult which is troubling. 

Instead, make him lose ALL ferocity stacks when ulting. This will never let Rengar oneshot like he did in the old days. The burst would be delayed and guess what, that was the main intention of the rework!
Yes, the old Q was not one shotting people. It was however, still inflicting a great amount of pain, and double Q usually could nearly kill a squishy, with his other spells it certainly did.
Yeah well it's the same for a Kha'Zix or a Talon really. Doesn't even have to be isolated.

In what universe is reverting Rengar "driving the game forward"? The only rework that's ever been reverted is Kog'maw and that's only because pre-rework Kog'maw, while somewhat bland, was at least inoffensive in design. No one can honestly say the same about pre-rework Rengar.

Basic PR 101: You never wade into a circlejerk and tell people no unless you absolutely have to. You have nothing to gain by opening your mouth when none of your answers will satisfy the mob, so keep silent. You don't need a response from Riot; the silence **is** your response.

The issue is, while Riot has been better about communicating with the community lately, they often ignore discussing certain topics such as this. Champions and their playerbases go ignored for years while others are specifically catered to and given significant open dialogue from Riot themselves. For example, let's look at Jhin who fell out of the top tier ADC category for the first time in a full year about two months ago. Reds comment on Jhin threads that they are looking for ways to bring Jhin back up and now buffs are headed out for him this Wednesday. If we look at another champion such as Tahm Kench, many threads discussing Tahm have been ignored despite him being in the lowest tier for supports over a year now. We even see threads asking simple questions like 'why can't Tahm Kench eat blue/red buff?' hit the front page quite often and go ignored. As a result, Tahm players feel very left out in comparison to Jhin players due to a lack of communication.

The same has been happening with the majority of champion reworks for a long time now. Players question reworks such as Malzahar's and Rengar's and what isn't working about the post-rework kit, but these discussions are never given any dialogue. They just go ignored, as Riot proceeds to nerf these champions patch after patch like they are all Azir and pretend like everything is alright when really a viable, fun champion has just been taking and thrown into the dumpster, along with the voices of the players who enjoyed that champion before any of this happened.
